what: R MS Tandem: a lightweight framework for protemic tandem mass spectrometry.
title: R MS Tandem: a lightweight framework for protemic tandem mass spectrometry.
text: simple tool calculating peptide sequence fragment masses.

title: R MS Tandem: a lightweight framework for protemic tandem mass spectrometry.
R MS Tandem: a lightweight framework for protemic tandem mass spectrometry.
text: Calculate mass peptide sequence Calculate mass peptide sequence mass modification Generate table expected fragment masses Read spectra using msreadr package Plot spectrum peak matching
code: library(mspredictr)  peptide_mass("SAMPLER") #> [1] 802.4007 peptide_mass("SA[M15.998]PLER") #> [1] 818.3987 fragments("SA[M15.998]PLER", charge = 1) #>     ion        mz z             seq pair pos      type #> 1   b1+  88.03931 1               S  p01   1         b #> 2   b2+ 159.07643 1              SA  p02   2         b #> 3   y1+ 175.11894 1               R  p06   1         y #> 4   y2+ 304.16153 1              ER  p05   2         y #> 5   b3+ 306.11491 1     SA[M15.998]  p03   3         b #> 6   b4+ 403.16767 1    SA[M15.998]P  p04   4         b #> 7  MH++ 410.20663 2 SA[M15.998]PLER  p00  NA precursor #> 8   y3+ 417.24559 1             LER  p04   3         y #> 9   y4+ 514.29836 1            PLER  p03   4         y #> 10  b5+ 516.25173 1   SA[M15.998]PL  p05   5         b #> 11  b6+ 645.29432 1  SA[M15.998]PLE  p06   6         b #> 12  y5+ 661.33684 1   [M15.998]PLER  p02   5         y #> 13  y6+ 732.37396 1  A[M15.998]PLER  p01   6         y #> 14  MH+ 819.40599 1 SA[M15.998]PLER  p00  NA precursor library(msreadr) ms2data <- msreadr::path_to_example() |> read_spectra() ms2data |> subset(spectrum_num == 1) |> plot_spectrum(peptides = 'HAVSEGTK')
